title: System on a chip
summary: A system on a chip (SoC; /ˌɛsˌoʊˈsiː/ es-oh-SEE or /sɒk/ sock[nb 1]) is an integrated circuit (also known as a "chip") that integrates all or most components of a computer or other electronic system. These components almost always include a central processing unit (CPU), memory, input/output ports and secondary storage, often alongside  other components such as radio modems and a graphics processing unit (GPU) – all on a single substrate or microchip.[1] It may contain digital, analog, mixed-signal, and often radio frequency signal processing functions (otherwise it is considered only an application processor).
